document.title: Maryland World-Readiness Standards for Learning Languages

D19B14B8DDAF4B2F99C0431FDF4C4A19.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

1CF0400EC5514E0593B8A3157C3019F9.description:
Travel to places where the target language is spoken and/or host visits by
speakers of the target language.

F888311E5A0045448256532D5413BCE0.description: Help organize and participate in cultural events and social activities.

2C1B4516B61C44C08AC93EE42E482071.description:
Regularly interact with speakers of the target language in face-to-face or
virtual settings.

7CF4896DB68845A1B29B44F9B57B73A4.description:
Regularly consult target language resources for personal enrichment,
entertainment, and professional advancement.

7136C18D96BB4152B24495059B6E7ABA.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

ACF2ADF3304A4B3FA811DF92B5E29BDD.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.

AB36626252514B91BCE4DB95D96F142A.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

DDB4992DE3D346518CBA788841C09A8E.description:
Join community or international groups that organize cultural events and
social activities.

BD89E579D2484BF68284F5D5A2970444.description: Follow and participate in sports or games played in the target culture.

F7CE78B1193542929F4446CDDA2F21BC.description:
Expand their knowledge and keep up with current events through target
language resources.

6DDF7D9EFCEB4755AB15DAA431BA17A4.description:
Seek out and interact with speakers of the target language who share
similar hobbies, goals, and interests, in face-to-face or virtual settings.

B58F63A714324AB0B3F38DA453127556.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

46554119B663414992DED968E6195FB6.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.

D2C0AB34FA6249BABDA20CC3830F83A6.description:
Explore the Internet to find sites of personal interest where they can use
the target language to maintain and increase their communication skills.

94B361D5421B46EF9B6FF0C4E73DA3D6.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

3FC64C957FA748AAA2B308E45CBAE57C.description: Attend or view cultural events and social activities.

1BDAA68F8A4449579D2E24F06A49C2F9.description: Use online resources in the target language to plan travel.

8F8FBD36479C419FB7F0ED96FA47CF3E.description: Learn sports or games played in the target culture.

EBF5BB6FB36445CC842B4917B66F0387.description:
Seek out and explore authentic materials in the target language related to
their hobbies, goals, and interests, and expand their vocabulary in their
areas.

C608F0200FB9404990F4AF9C9237C6CD.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the SMART goals they
have set for each unit of instruction.

1DD7F3BBEBC84F91B231290726471548.description:
Use the NCSSFL-ACTFL Can-Do Global Benchmarks to set SMART
goals (specific, measurable, attainable, relevant, and timebound) to
monitor and reflect on their progress in communication skills.

BDCFD54644A240AC94683D560EE5AA3D.description: LIFELONG LEARNING: Learners set goals and reflect on their progress in using language for enjoyment, enrichment, and advancement.

7B2EFFCD434A46998F65E1D026BC12CA.description:
Conduct research in the target language or assist in the translation of
resources for the benefit of a community organization.

B3089D4127C44F6CABC6934ADF4E3DC4.description: Write and illustrate stories to present to others.

2617AE4EFF1341C0AF0EC37D8955560D.description:
Initiate and organize language club activities that benefit the school,
community, or other organizations.

37214734CFF845D39F112A87AA883361.description:
Use community resources in addition to library and online resources to
research a topic related to culture and/or language study.

3E6511E2276C4376B0E0420A8D3D6813.description:
Volunteer for a community organization, participate in a career
exploration or school-to-work project, or complete an internship that
requires proficiency in the target language and culture.

585AEB00652F4F9F812269F11E0872F8.description:
Discuss and express opinions on current events and issues through
interpersonal oral or written exchanges with speakers of the target
language and/or students in other classes, in face-to-face or virtual
settings (e.g., social media, instant messaging, video conferencing)/

F3F8AC51CC92414AB54A667772817E9A.description:
Participate in language club activities that benefit the school, community,
or other organizations.

EF0609362AA642EBBDC9F786BFE60998.description:
Solicit, organize, and present information from a speaker of the target
language about a cultural event or a topic of interest.

F5348503CAE342208023A5007CD8C97D.description:
Interview members of communities, whether local or beyond, about how
they use their knowledge of language personally and professionally, in
face-to-face or virtual settings.

930E53F28F5348CB88735C4A368C988D.description:
Discuss topics of personal interest through interpersonal oral or written
exchanges with speakers of the target language and/or students in other
classes, in face-to-face or virtual settings (e.g., social media, instant
messaging, video conferencing).

1A1A54CBD7A648CA8A13349E85F33673.description: Perform for school, campus, or community celebrations.

91585E555F6D461ABDB798BB92F2426C.description: Write and illustrate short stories to present to others.

3196D78D7AFB41CBB709F63C169DF161.description:
Prepare a group presentation or performance for a school, campus, or
community event.

1C0DEA2B37C14CBAA9B5E85F1063C77C.description:
Write and illustrate short texts intended for a specific audience in
collaboration with students in other classes.

29CFCBD644C446159A41680D5EB60FFF.description: Simulate interactions that might take place in a community setting.

9DD341029396456DB0C504EF9F7158E8.description:
Identify professions of interest to them that require proficiency in another
language.

42A657FA62C8403D87D6652A5E8C519A.description:
Exchange basic information about themselves, their studies, or their
family with speakers of the target language and/or students in other
classes, in face-to-face or virtual settings (e.g., social media, instant
messaging, video conferencing).

CFA07A4484884D3D851FB576C5E22903.description: SCHOOL AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES: Learners use the language both within and beyond the classroom to interact and collaborate in their community and the globalized world.

3FFC4C76228240AC90CEEC81D1C58BDB.description: COMMUNITIES: Learners communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in multilingual communities at home and around the world.

50F5BFCA83B24B2DB78E8AFF0DFDC69B.description:
Identify, examine, and analyze the relationship between cultural products,
practices, and perspectives in the target culture and their own by
conducting research, observations, and interviews.

EEB5F77757984EC9B869F29CB07C8E78.description:
Identify, analyze, and discuss tangible and intangible products and their
use in the target culture and their own, as represented in authentic
materials (e.g., literary texts, films, social media, interviews, news
stories)

7C27818E566A4B5E9ED45399EE207FDC.description:
Identify, discuss, and analyze social, economic, and political institutions
and related perspectives in the target culture and their own.

13036D9CE87E4CDB8CBE920BA08D9780.description:
Compare cultural nuances of meanings of words, idioms, and vocal
inflections in the target language and their won.

CB41D7AB8E5A4DD1882F94BB9CA9BBB3.description:
Hypothesize about the origins and use of idioms as reflections of culture,
citing examples from the language and culture being studied and their
own.

3055143187124A60861248613EF603A8.description:
Report on the relationship between word order and meaning and
hypothesize on how this may or may not reflect the ways in which
cultures organize information and view the world.

5D5C6A8C63C747FEB3C7388E2387DA5A.description:
Compare and contrast authentic materials (e.g., creative works, news,
social media) from the target culture and their own to identify and
analyze practices and perspectives of the target culture and their own.

97EC25043D434C03BBB5DDE2B12106E2.description:
Identify, investigate, and compare/contrast the function of everyday
objects (e.g., household items, tools, foods, clothing) produced in the
target cultures and their own.

4467073F82AB4C51BD1F64E71F88F0B9.description:
Document and contrast verbal and nonverbal behavior in daily activities
among peers or mixed groups in the target cultures and their own.

BCC1D521569F4D5CAB49D767445AB28B.description: Identify and discuss similarities and differences in themes and techniques in creative works from the target culture and their own.

A92D7AD3E53F4C838BCA07E466AB812E.description:
Demonstrate and compare/contrast appropriate gestures and oral
expressions for greetings, leave takings, and other common social
interactions in the target culture and their own.

955B5ABC1A494C8EB68825C904C7104D.description:
Observe, identify, and compare/contrast simple patterns of behavior or
interaction in various settings in the target culture and their own.

142483AFA1D2427DB5DC30912FD6BA67.description:
Identify, describe, and compare/contrast products (e.g., tools, toys,
clothing, homes, foods) and their use in the target cultures and their own.

2B1CC15AB2A948C5BD5CA91F3C3D5016.description: CULTURAL COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the concept of culture through comparisons of the cultures studied and their own.

44388E55AF7B48E7B7282B0453BBCE16.description:
Identify, compare, and analyze sociolinguistic patterns in the language
they are learning and their own by conducting online and library research,
observations, and interviews.

AE2F3EF0DC66402EBB0CAA37E241171F.description:
Analyze and compare differences between spoken and written grammar
and lexicon in the language they are learning and their own, taking into
account audience, purpose, and genre.

B026B0C581DE4C55A8F9B398DED63439.description:
Identify lexical and grammatical gaps between the language they are
learning and their own and develop strategies for expressing nuance
despite these gaps.

E9BDC220734A4330848C3A41830F5E17.description:
Identify and analyze lexical and grammatical changes in the language
they are learning and their own (e.g., disappearance of tenses,
obsolescence, neologisms) and speculate about the evolution of language.

C566469950934E45BBDC24DD08923F94.description:
Identify patterns and explain discrepancies between the sound and writing
systems in the language they are learning and their own.

89D0F2834D82422FBD4EA1D36BD86D2D.description:
Identify and compare language appropriate to specific social groups and
situations in the language they are learning and their own.

A16B1E4A1F0E46D8A6DC2AFC938DB6A4.description:
Compare and analyze idiomatic expressions in the language they are
learning and their own, and hypothesize about their origins.

14012DE1FB53419A92FCD75B2A152493.description:
Identify and use borrowed words and cognates in the language they are
learning and their own, and hypothesize about their origins.

67662C8951F0428E861F70451A395205.description:
Identify similarities and differences between the sound and writing
systems in the language they are learning and their own.

5DC860DAACF54C1F80371A658A99BB73.description:
Observe and compare registers of language (e.g., formal and informal) in
greetings and leave-takings and other common social interactions in the
language they are learning and their own.

D3933AC6E19040F1902B80FA4AC0C9B1.description:
Inventory and compare idiomatic expressions in the language they are
learning and their own.

0376363C02A3464191EEB4BDB8C23C82.description:
Inventory idiomatic expressions in both their native language and the
language being learned and talk about how idiomatic expressions work in
general.

89AC3A67015643AC8F496BACBE3E9A8F.description:
Identify cognates between the target language and their native language
and cite the patterns that connect them, and they detect false cognates
when the context in which they see them suggests a misfit.

DE9C0E73DE294A26B32EB9A83D8538C5.description:
Cite and use examples of words that are similar in the language they are
learning and their native language and they pose guesses about why
languages in general might need to borrow words.

C90574E25AB8474BA4393C64C60981E4.description: LANGUAGE COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain and reflect on the nature of language through comparisons of the language studied and their own.

7D705B4D9EF24B1F9A437164406E0572.description: COMPARISONS: Learners develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with cultural competence.

2BCEC4519B074C068949DE814C840252.description:
Compare, analyze, and present on how and why advertisements for the
same product differ in the target culture and the United States.

97B81A899B3B4FA0AB6955E1350868C5.description:
Research and debate global issues as represented in target language
news sources with different political slants.

F50277B03B134533AF374E097C5EFE47.description:
Discuss and analyze representations of pedagogical practices in literary
texts and films.

F993C8BF5DF94FEE8449BB5CC2DCBF62.description:
Identify and analyze pedagogical approaches used in instructional
websites and materials created for speakers of the target language.

13705B5194B643A5AA1C80DEC5F2FEAE.description:
Present on an internationally known figure from history, science, or the
arts using target language resources.

1422B49D30CA40BD9B2C57E1C0A32DBF.description:
Find, compare, and discuss coverage of current events in the target
culture and in the United States.

B2719EC0381E4088A7E861F0B672E52A.description:
Analyze instructional websites and materials created for speakers of the
target language and compare them to instructional resources in the
United States.

6B41F30201C945808ABB156A9BDEE604.description: Discuss short texts and videos from the target culture.

867579ACDC704DA8B99F6B6B8C2FF606.description: Explore news media and identify the subject areas and topics.

4314598F0482477A84754CB7BBD3FD5D.description:
Explore instructional websites and materials created for speakers of the
target language and identify the subject areas and topics (e.g., history
lesson on immigration, a geography lesson on trade routes, a biology
lesson on cell structure).

86C50E5E069A4FB6BCAD110D84F41D2D.description: ACQUIRING INFORMATION AND DIVERSE PERSPECTIVES: Learners access and evaluate information and diverse perspectives that are available through the language and its cultures.

EB0DFABB3DF546F494B58EBEC4659E3D.description: Identify and analyze characteristics of different text types and genres.

37B37336B1BF415EB3AFE418C60F2B43.description:
Analyze and present information on a topic studied in other classes by
conducting online and library research, observations, and interviews.

15A2CB384F1C4FE1B2296BCDD6772132.description:
Explore, discuss, and debate topics from other academic subjects,
including political and historical concepts, worldwide health issues,
and environmental concerns.

D3DAD2ECB5DB4D55BEAC9CBD56078C97.description:
Read, view, compare, and classify different text types and genres (with an
emphasis on interpreting content and form).

FDDEEA795BB24EC9BD7AEEE0B55A776A.description:
Draw on knowledge they have gained in another academic subject to
discuss topics in the target language.

588158FA1E4C41B3956BBBF43E73516C.description:
Prepare and present a concept in the target language that they studied in
another academic subject (e.g., historical facts and concepts,
mathematical terms and problems, scientific information).

594446D4BF5B41E298FC59DFB872B3D9.description:
Read and view different text types and genres (with an emphasis on
interpreting content).

58EBC3AF17F14519A646AE5D3005C4EE.description:
Draw and mark maps (of places where they live and places where the
target language is spoken) with civic and geographic features studied in
other classes.

B6643F9C559D4B83A5710EE40F148970.description:
Identify, label, describe, and compare items in the target language on
charts and visuals used as instructional materials in other content areas,
such as mathematics, art, geography, music, or social sciences.

195244651B4A4820BBDB483CD6DFB8F0.description: MAKING CONNECTIONS: Learners build, reinforce, and expand their knowledge of other disciplines while using the language to develop critical thinking and to solve problems creatively.

814A4B81041C49208C241CD9B9742B60.description: CONNECTIONS: Learners connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in order to use the language to function in academic and career-related situations.

6D87DE179F2D40089147AB7C88D1917A.description:
Identify, examine, and analyze the relationship between cultural products
and perspectives by conducting online and library research, observations,
and interviews.

676A80B5234B4DD080DB100A76C24194.description:
Identify, analyze, and discuss tangible and intangible products and their
use as represented in authentic materials (e.g., literary texts, films, social
media, interviews, news stories).

6C81FC648AF54888B2359DA022E9AB01.description:
Identify, discuss, and analyze social, economic, and political institutions,
and explore relationships among these institutions and the perspectives of
the target culture.

C6E4C3C30762494CA3ABD02A814382A9.description:
Use evidence-based details to explain and analyze the historical, social,
economic, and/or political significance of products found in the target
culture.

17B54429FAD1403FA4C9BA8FE8F7764B.description:
Identify and discuss perspectives reflected in creative works of the target
culture such as traditional and contemporary music, literature, dance, and
art.

F2DCDE5002684DC783C9C7F8DD27A1EC.description:
Compare and analyze perspectives reflected in news reports, social
media, pamphlets, advertisements, legislation, etc.)

B0987E4B5CDE4EDAAA43EE15BD73D56D.description:
Identify, investigate, and analyze the function of everyday objects
produced in the target culture (e.g., household items, tools, foods, and
clothing).

BD0CF6365B964A43B224553FB14DF0F2.description:
Experience (read, listen to, observe, perform) expressive products of the
target culture (e.g., stories, poetry, music, paintings, dance, drama) and
explain the origin and importance of these products in today’s culture.

53B635151CC04A6787308C79FD879BB3.description:
Create cultural triangles and describe the connections of products to
associated practices and perspectives.

3D2FDB75995C4C3FACFF7BEDE951DD2F.description:
Listen to and/or sing songs from the target culture, identifying the
musician and country of origin.

1362F63998DD4934B1CC65E039EC4548.description:
Watch video clips of commercials or television programs in order to
identify products and their use in the target culture.

BDF66B03B7FF4186BFE494CA16DE4966.description:
Listen to and/or read short poems, stories, or plays from the target
culture, identifying the author and country of origin.

075C5F857BB24E6596CD987BA96EAA14.description: Observe and demonstrate how products are used in the target culture.

30E3AE3E30F043B49338EC6C2505DEC6.description:
Identify, discuss, and produce types of artwork, crafts, or graphic
representations enjoyed or made by their peer group within the target
culture such as models of monuments, mosaics, murals, and traditional
recipes.

455D893754C14198A32191CC10C7A55F.description:
Identify and observe tangible products of the target culture such as toys,
dress, homes, monuments, currency, famous people, and art.

1675452F2DB14671BEB2072742E42EBD.description:
RELATING CULTURAL PRODUCTS TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the products and perspectives of the cultures
studied.

AB893BAC25CE48E5B22F85FA9F1E1535.description:
Identify, examine, and analyze connections between socially accepted
behavioral practices and cultural perspectives by conducting online and
library research, observations, and interviews.

AFD625F470B64CD4B7E0B205E1B80A12.description:
Prepare oral and written presentations with attention to the cultural
background of the audience.

EC2C10F685634599A9943A433212C127.description:
Identify, analyze, and discuss various patterns of behavior or interaction
typical of the culture studied as represented in authentic materials, (e.g.,
literary texts, films, social media, interviews, news stories).

36C408BFAFDB49ADBCEB929A1D4DE302.description:
Engage in discussions with native speakers using culturally appropriate
behaviors and language to express agreement and disagreement.

237E3E43D60C4001A3913D289CB5CA29.description:
Interact in a variety of peer- or mixed-group cultural activities, using
appropriate verbal and nonverbal cues.

DC7F9453576B4542BAC9F2A2CD8461D3.description:
Engage in conversations with native speakers in a culturally respectful
way.

44B6FBB332D3460C86252A8C46337D18.description: Use formal and informal forms of address appropriately.

56E785274066493283B93ACD00C2826C.description:
Interpret authentic materials (e.g., short stories, videos, infographics,
instruction booklets, magazine articles) to identify and analyze practices
(e.g., respecting social media etiquette, finding a job, respecting the
environment, dating, child rearing) that reflect perspectives of the target
culture.

6CC419AC5A59464FA647F9C6448C1B42.description:
Suggest cultural triangles with reasons connecting practices to associated
products and perspectives.

0DD5363B2BBF48388253CFF6471EB066.description:
Role play a variety of situations from the target culture, using culturally
appropriate behaviors and expressions.

091BBD99BE874194848F0F123FCFCF25.description:
Begin to adjust language, behaviors, and messages to acknowledge
audiences with different cultural backgrounds.

876FBADE5B774CB5BDC0F387A589AB7C.description:
Explore, analyze, and present to others how (and why) common cultural
practices and procedures are carried out (e.g., how to set a table, how to
participate in an election, how to accept or decline an invitation).

89BF7D6FC36546C6B1FC1C376EF8431A.description:
Use culturally appropriate verbal and nonverbal behavior in daily
activities among peers or mixed groups.

5FA33B5A47484D2E82934F4FA3A62DF3.description:
Observe, analyze, and exchange information on patterns of behavior
typical of their peers and other groups from the target cultures found in
authentic materials such as video clips, blogs, and magazine and
newspaper articles.

E94421E2085C4ECA852FF8CF33BAC1AC.description:
Participate in age-appropriate cultural practices such as games (e.g., role
of leader, taking turns), sports, and entertainment (e.g., music, dance,
drama).

466271EDBBB64ACF8E60AFFD815247A0.description:
Observe, analyze, and exchange information on patterns of behavior
typical of their peer group in the culture, such as observing and analyzing
how different ways of greeting and leave-taking reflect the relationships
between people in the target culture.

4DC2705C266144C28567A416072AC2C7.description:
List and identify practices observed in a video that are outcomes of
perspectives of the target culture.

C37DF948B15A4E6995955F2CBFDDE920.description:
Observe, identify, and/or imitate simple patterns of behavior or
interaction in various settings such as campus, family, and the
community.

54867C4E58994253AB8FF4CBC9B40962.description:
Create or propose simple cultural triangles connecting practices to
associated products and perspectives.

0C2839C692934C5CA143814C2550B908.description:
Participate in or simulate age-appropriate cultural activities such as
games, birthday celebrations, storytelling, and dramatizations.

8E2CC8892F5941A19827156F5A850DF1.description:
Use appropriate gestures and oral expressions for greetings, leave
takings, and common classroom or social interactions.

CF07528781A141A490DB66D5EFF68E36.description: RELATING CULTURAL PRACTICES TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.

E9F62707C3BB4280ADA48D3B849EE04C.description: CULTURES: Learners interact with cultural competence and understanding.
